src:
Vodstvo reprezentance upa, da bo v Istri zavel nov veter
06 Nov 2019, 06:02 by Aleš Sorta

Po svetlem septembru in črnem oktobru je pred slovensko reprezentanco zadnja akcija v kvalifikacijah za evropsko prvenstvo. November bržkone ne bo pomenil prelomnice v tem ciklu, lahko pa bi nakazal razširjen nabor rešitev za prihodnost. To upa tudi selektor Matjaž Kek, ki je včeraj objavil seznam nogometašev za dvoboja z Latvijo in Poljsko.



Matjaž Kek že gleda v prihodnost.  Foto: STA

BRDO PRI KRANJU > Slovenijo ohranja v igri za drugo mesto, ki še vodi na evropsko prvenstvo leta 2020, le teorija. Je pa res, da upanje umira zadnje in dokler obstajajo možnosti, velja obdržati tekmovalni naboj. Ne nazadnje bi bil lahko uspešen zaključek kvalifikacij tudi naložba za prihodnost. Predvsem igralsko. Porazni oktober je spet potisnil v ospredje vprašanje, ali je to dejanski rezultatski in igralski limit Slovenije ali premore Matjaž Kek še kakšnega asa iz rokava.
Po spletu okoliščin oziroma sili razmer je slovenski selektor vendarle nekoliko prevetril seznam vpoklicanih v primerjavi z zadnjo akcijo. Ali gre le za kozmetične popravke ali za uporabne rešitve, bo seveda pokazal čas. Pri Martinu Milcu, Amedeju Vetrihu, Harisu Vučkiću ali Rajku Repu je težko reči, da gre za osvežitve, še manj pa, da gre za novi val oziroma mlade sile. Ima pa vsak zase za sabo zanimivo nogometno zgodbo. Roman Bezjak in Domen Črnigoj sta načeta, manjka tudi kaznovani Denis Popović.
Reprezentančni seznam> vratarji: Jan Oblak (Atletico Madrid), Vid Belec (Apoel), Nejc Vidmar (Olimpija);> branilci: Bojan Jokić (Ufa), Miha Mevlja (Soči), Aljaž Struna (Houston Dynamo), Petar Stojanović (Dinamo Zagreb), Martin Milec (Maribor), Jure Balkovec (Empoli), Miha Blažič (Ferencvaros), Uroš Korun (Piast Gliwice);> vezisti: Josip Iličić (Atalanta), Jasmin Kurtić (Spal), Rene Krhin (Nantes), Benjamin Verbič (Dinamo Kijev), Miha Zajc (Fenerbahce), Jaka Bijol (CSKA Moskva), Amedej Vetrih (Rizespor), Žan Majer (Lecce), Rajko Rep (Hartberg);> napadalci: Tim Matavž (Vitesse), Robert Berić (St. Etienne), Andraž Šporar (Slovan Bratislava), Haris Vučkić (Twente).
Milec bo edini predstavnik iz prve slovenske lige, potem ko Kek tokrat ni povabil Luke Zahovića. V napadalnem izboru je prvič Vučkić, ki je vselej veljal za nogometaša s odličnimi telesnimi predispozicijami. Newcastle ga ni izbral zaman, pa čeprav se je na Otoku, kjer je po raznih posojah prebil skoraj desetletje, pokazala njegova krhkost oziroma nagnjenost k poškodbam. Pri 27 letih pa doživlja nogometni preporod na Nizozemskem.
Zgodba zase je tudi 29-letni Rajko Rep, ki je veljal za velikega upa slovenskega nogometa v času Celja in Maribora ter vseh mlajših reprezentančnih selekcij. Njegov nogometni razvoj v članski konkurenci nato ni sledil pričakovanim obetom. Leta 2014 je praktično odprl novo poglavje pri celovškem tretjeligašu. Zdaj je že drugo sezono vidni član avstrijskega prvoligaša. Tudi za Goričanom Amedejem Vetrihom, ki ga je v izbrano vrsto povabil že Srečko Katanec, je trnova nogometna pot. Pred prestopom v Turčijo iz Domžal je moral prestati tudi polletno kazen zaradi dopinškega prekrška.
“Imamo težave na obeh bokih in tu vidim Milca kot eno od možnih rešitev, predvsem ker v zadnjem obdobju redno igra. Vetrih ima polno minutažo v turški ligi in si zasluži priložnost, Rep igra že nekaj časa dobro v avstrijski ligi. Lahko je dobra alternativa za Bezjaka. Za Vučkića pa sem vesel, da se je tak talent po težkem obdobju s poškodbami vrnil. Zasluži si priložnost,” je povedal Kek, ki bo svoje izbrance pozdravil v ponedeljek v Portorožu. Do sobotne (16. novembra) tekme z Latvijo v Stožicah bodo reprezentanti vadili na Bonifiki.
text:
The national team hopes to see a new wind in Istria
06 Nov 2019, 06:02 by Aleš Sorta

After the bright September and the black October, the last action in the European Championship qualifiers is ahead of the Slovenian national team. November is unlikely to be a turning point in this cycle, but it could indicate an expanded set of solutions for the future. This is also hoped by coach Matjaz Kek, who yesterday announced the list of players for duels with Latvia and Poland.



Matjaz Kek is already looking to the future. Photo: STA

BRDO PRI KRANJU> Keeping Slovenia in the game for second place, which still leads to the 2020 European Championships, is just a theory. It is true, however, that hope dies last, and as long as there are opportunities, it should be kept competitive. Last but not least, successful completion of qualifications could also be an investment for the future. Mostly acting. The defeat of October again brought to the fore the question of whether this is the actual result and player limit of Slovenia or a break by Matjaž Kek.
Due to a combination of circumstances or circumstances, the Slovenian selector nevertheless slightly checked the list of called-ups compared to the last campaign. Whether it's just cosmetic repairs or workable solutions, of course, time will tell. With Martin Milc, Amede Vetrich, Haris Vuckic or Rajko Rep, it is hard to say that these are refreshments, much less a new wave or young forces. But everyone has an interesting football story behind them. Roman Bezjak and Domen Črnigoj are kicked off, and Denis Popovic is also missing.
National List> Goalkeepers: Jan Oblak (Atletico Madrid), Vid Belec (Apoel), Nejc Vidmar (Olympia);> Defenders: Bojan Jokić (Ufa), Miha Mevlja (Sochi), Aljaz Struna (Houston Dynamo), Petar Stojanovic (Dinamo Zagreb), Martin Milec (Maribor), Jure Balkovec (Empoli), Miha Blazic (Ferencvaros), Uros Korun (Piast Gliwice);> midfielders: Josip Ilicic (Atalanta), Jasmin Kurtic (Spal), Rene Krhin (Nantes), Benjamin Verbich (Dynamo Kyiv), Miha Zajc (Fenerbahce), Jaka Biyol (CSKA Moscow), Ameday Vetrich (Rizespor), Jean Mayer (Lecce), Rajko Rep (Hartberg);> strikers: Tim Matavz (Vitesse), Robert Beric (St Etienne), Andraz Sporar (Slovan Bratislava), Haris Vuckic (Twente).
Milec will be the only representative from the first Slovenian league after Kek did not invite Luka Zahovic this time. For the first time in the offensive selection, Vučkić was always considered a footballer with excellent physical predispositions. He was not selected in vain by Newcastle, though his fragility or injury prone showed on the Island, where he had spent almost a decade on various loans. At 27, he is experiencing a football rebirth in the Netherlands.
The story for himself is also 29-year-old Rajko Rep, who was considered a great hope of Slovenian football during the times of Celje and Maribor and all the younger national team selections. His football development in member competition then did not keep up with the expected outlook. In 2014, he practically opened a new chapter at the Klagenfurt third team. He is now a prominent member of the Austrian Premier League for the second season. Even after Goričko, Amede Vetrih, who has already been invited by Srečko Katanec to the selected series, is a thorny football path. Before moving to Turkey from Domzale, he also had to serve a half-year sentence for a doping offense.
“We have problems on both sides, and I see Milc here as one of the possible solutions, especially since he has been playing regularly in the last period. Vetrih has full minutes in the Turkish league and deserves a chance, and Rep has been playing well in the Austrian league for some time. It can be a good alternative for Bezjak. For Vučkić, however, I am glad that such talent has returned after a difficult period with injuries. It deserves a chance, ”said Kek, who will welcome his constituents on Monday in Portorož. Until Saturday (November 16th) the match with Latvia in Stozice will be rehearsed at Bonifica.
